qas.question: How did the Windows 9.1 upgrade enhance desktop startup?
What main feature was taken away from the desktop?
How many apps did the WIndows 9.1 update allow to be snapped onto a signular display?

context: The upgrade addressed a number of criticisms faced by Windows 8 upon its release, with additional customization options for the Start screen, the restoration of <a2_0><b7_0>a visible Start button<b7_0/><a2_0/> on the desktop, the ability to snap <a3_0><b8_0>up to four<b8_0/><a3_0/> apps on a single display, and the <a1_0><b6_0>ability to boot to the desktop instead of the Start screen<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Windows 8's stock apps were also updated, a new <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>Bing<b5_0/>-based unified search system<b4_0/><a0_0/> was added, SkyDrive was given deeper integration with the operating system, and a number of new stock apps, along with a tutorial, were added. Windows 8.1 also added support for 3D printing, Miracast media streaming, NFC printing, and Wi-Fi Direct.
